channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12511] namespace permissions - add support from table creation privilege in a namespace 'C'
item.description: As discussed in namespace permission Jira. A user granted a 'C' on a namespace enables a user to create tables within the namespace. 'C' on a namespace does not enable a user to create/drop the namespace.
item.summary: namespace permissions - add support from table creation privilege in a namespace 'C'

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Francis Liu When will you plan to push your internal patch to branch-1? From Enis Soztutar, this is important for 1.0 release (which will happen soon).

Stephen Yuan Jiang My teammate Huaiyu Zhu is working on it as we speak. So there should be something up this week.

Enis Soztutar I tried assigning the jira to Huaiyu Zhu but I couldn't. Can you add him?
I added him, and assigned the issue. Thanks Francis Liu.

Enis Soztutar I have prepared the patch, please review it at
https://reviews.apache.org/r/28774/

I was checking code for this patch. It seems that we may already have this functionality.

https://hbase.apache.org/book/appendix_acl_matrix.html tells otherwise though. It should be updated.

This message is automatically generated.

The current code requires global permission 'CREATE'. However, there is a bug in 'requireGlobalPermission' which checks NS permissions. It should not check NS here since global has stronger security requirement. I update the patch to fix the bug.

now we need to check NS 'CREATE' before creating table.

This message is automatically generated.

The current code requires global permission 'CREATE'. However, there is a bug in 'requireGlobalPermission' which checks NS permissions

It seems serious, but I lack the history for this. Maybe Andrew Purtell can shine some light. I thought it is intentional.

It seems that we should really modify the TestAccessController to test ALL combinations in https://hbase.apache.org/book/appendix_acl_matrix.html. Right now that test does not do any NS checks AFAIK.
The particular line got committed as part of HBASE-12098. IMO, both of these fixes are functionally equivalent, with no side effects. But, this fix looks much cleaner though.

Right now that test does not do any NS checks AFAIK.

There are some tests in TestNamespaceCommands

Skimmed the patch.
AFAIK
There is already a requirePermission API for NS, why not use that ?
There is already a test in TestNamespaceCommands for grant on NS, can we just modify that ?

Sorry, I didn't notice this line is a fix for NS 'create'. IMO, it is a little bit confusing to have NS checked in requireGlobalPermission method. A user has NS level privileges should not pass global permission check without actual global privileges.

Ashish Singhi which requirePermission API did you suggest?
You're right, it is a good idea to put unit test in TestNamespaceCommands.

which requirePermission API did you suggest?

This one requireGlobalPermission(String request, Action perm, String namespace)
If required you can change the log message here, AFAIK it is used only for NS check.

Huaiyu Zhu One doubt here.
A user with 'C' permission on a NS can create a table in it. Can't the same user delete the table from there ?

Agreed with deleteTable, and possibly others (modify table) etc which should be fixed together with createTable.

One problem with the patch is that, it relies on exception catching for the regular code path, which is quite costly. The exception should not be raised in the global check. If at the end of global + NS check it fails, only then the exception should be thrown.

This one requireGlobalPermission(String request, Action perm, String namespace)

This method checks global permission only. It is used to grant/revoke/modifyNS. We still need a new requirePermission for NS+global checks.

Agreed with deleteTable, and possibly others (modify table) etc which should be fixed together with createTable.

There is no need to fix them. When requirePermission("deleteTable", tableName, null, null, Action.ADMIN, Action.CREATE) is called in preDeleteTable/preModifyTable, it does not only check table permission but also checks NS and global ones. This behavior is implemented in different versions of authManager.authorize methods.

But create table is different, because before we create the table, the table permission does not even exist. We need a requirePermission for namespace+global checks. This is the missing function I added in the patch.

it relies on exception catching for the regular code path, which is quite costly. The exception should not be raised in the global check. If at the end of global + NS check it fails, only then the exception should be thrown.

Agree, raise an additional exception is unnecessary. Since requirePermission checks both global and ns, I just removed the globalRequirePermission.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12685813/HBASE-12511.patch
against master branch at commit 9e9be97af735a27769f4b348b72f065acaa1380c.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12685813

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/12000//console

This message is automatically generated.

A few minor concerns. Can you please delete the test added as part of HBASE-12098? We don't need two tests for verifying the same functionality. Also, please update the calls to requireGlobalPermission(String request, Action perm, String namespace) with the new function you are adding i.e. requirePermission(String request, String namespace, Action... permissions) so that we're the existing functionality remains unchanged?

We don't need two tests for verifying the same functionality

Yes, I have merged my test into the old one, we have only one test now.

Also, please update the calls to requireGlobalPermission(String request, Action perm, String namespace)

The newly added requirePermission is used in preCreateTable to check namespace permission (it also checks global permission, that's why I replaced requireGlobalPermission). I think preCreateTable is the only place we need to change at the moment.

In the following methods, requireGlobalPermission is being used.

  • getUserPermissions
  • grant (L#2040)
  • postListNamespaceDescriptors
  • preDeleteNamespace
  • preGetNamespaceDescriptor
  • preModifyNamespace
  • revoke (Line#2091)
    I think using requirePermission make more sense in these cases because admin permission on namespace should also be able to get the permissions going, not just global permissions. Thoughts?

Looks like those methods need to be refactored the same as preCreate(). Except for:

  • getUserPermissions - seems to have logic error when trying to check for namespace permission
  • preGetNamespaceDescriptor, postListNamespaceDescriptors - This should not require any privilege as mentioned in HBASE-8015
  • preDeleteNamespace, preModifyNamespace - requires global permission, namespace permission does not allow namespace DDL permission privilege as mentioned in HBASE-8015.

Enis Soztutar should we repuprpose this jira to address namespace refactoring/corrections here to reflect what was agreed upon in HBASE-8015?

preGetNamespaceDescriptor, postListNamespaceDescriptors - This should not require any privilege as mentioned in HBASE-8015

Mean to say we should just let it pass through (no privileges required) till 'L' is implemented.
Enis Soztutar should we correct the behavior changes mentioned here for 1.0? Or is it ok to change behavior in 1.1?

I think using requirePermission make more sense in these cases because admin permission on namespace should also be able to get the permissions going, not just global permissions

Agreed. But in this case, we should at least rename the method so that it is clear it requires global or NS perms.

preGetNamespaceDescriptor, postListNamespaceDescriptors - This should not require any privilege as mentioned in HBASE-8015

Seems fine till we get L permission. Can we re-use X in any way? Unix dir permission uses X for dir listing.

preDeleteNamespace, preModifyNamespace - requires global permission, namespace permission does not allow namespace DDL permission privilege as mentioned in HBASE-8015.

So we have to fix this case, because having ADMIN on NS will allow you to delete the NS? Delete table will work if you have C on table, don't we want the same?

Enis Soztutar should we correct the behavior changes mentioned here for 1.0? Or is it ok to change behavior in 1.1?

Yeah, was looking at this since I am trying to cut the RC.
It seems the original goal for the jira is already fulfilled. For the other changes (esp. preGetNSDescriptor) if we can have a patch and agree on the changes, we can sink the RC for that since it will be better to have it in.

Yeah lets try and get it in. It'd be better not to surprise users. If already captured I'd like to follow what was agreed up in HBASE-9206.

Seems fine till we get L permission. Can we re-use X in any way? Unix dir permission uses X for dir listing.

X is for coprocessor (at least in 98). The overload of privileges would be confusing?

So we have to fix this case, because having ADMIN on NS will allow you to delete the NS? Delete table will work if you have C on table, don't we want the same?

Except for the special case for 'C'. Namespace privileges is mainly used as another level of hierarchy (privileges to be inherited by tables). ie We might want user to have C on namespace so he can create tables but we don't want that user to be able to drop the namespace. Same goes with the other privileges. Another use case was to prevent users from altering namespace configuration (ie quota).

Yeah lets try and get it in. It'd be better not to surprise users. If already captured I'd like to follow what was agreed up in HBASE-9206.

Ok, let me delay the RC until tomorrow, since today is already late anyway.

X is for coprocessor (at least in 98). The overload of privileges would be confusing?

Right. Let's be explicit.

Except for the special case for 'C'. Namespace privileges is mainly used as another level of hierarchy (privileges to be inherited by tables). ie We might want user to have C on namespace so he can create tables but we don't want that user to be able to drop the namespace.

Sounds good.

Sounds good.

So just to summarize the behavior for namespace privilege for namespace will be as follows. Nothing more nothing less:

1. RWXCA on a namespace is inherited by tables (addressed in this jira)
2. C on a namespace grants a user/group privilege to create tables within a namespace (addressed in this jira)

Follow-up in a separate jira:

1. L privilege for listing namespaces
2. L Privelege for get namespace descriptor (tho C might also be ok but think about that more when implementing L)

Can we have Huaiyu Zhu address these issues in this patch?
Sorry meant to say can Huaiyu Zhu address the issues in this jira?

Sorry meant to say can Huaiyu Zhu address the issues in this jira?

If we can have an updated patch tomorrow, I'll include that in the RC.
I'll prepare a patch by tomorrow.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12687989/HBASE-12511.patch
against master branch at commit 83e4bfaf73e1c7db16835b20c4f996adde30054a.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12687989

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/12133//console

This message is automatically generated.

As we agreed:
1. table creation requires minimal NS 'C'.
2. other table managements (delete/modify/etc) require minimal table 'A|C'
3. namespace managements require minimal global 'A'
4. 'L' is not implemented here

I fixed the requireGlobalPermission so that it only checks global. Added a new method requireNamespacePermission for checking namespace. modify the unit tests to verify:
1. if you have NS 'C', you can create table under the namespace
2. if you have only NS 'A', you CANNOT create table under the namespace
3. if you have only NS 'A', you CANNOT grant/revoke namespace permissions or modify namespace
Can a global admin can create table?

Can a global admin can create table?

No. but global admin can delete/modify the table.

I've rebased the patch, and changed TestNamespaceCommands to be more extensive and a lot more readable. The test implements this logic: 


createNamespace        : superuser | global(A)

deleteNamespace        : superuser | global(A) | NS(A)

modifyNamespace        : superuser | global(A) | NS(A)

getNamespaceDescriptor : superuser | global(A) | NS(A)

listNamespaces         : All access*

createTable            : superuser | global(C) | NS(C)

grant 

  NS Permission        : superuser | global(A) | NS(A)

revoke 

  NS Permission        : superuser | global(A) | NS(A)

getPerms 

  NS permissions       : superuser | global(A) | NS(A)



* Returned list will only show what you can call getNamespaceDescriptor()

Patch looks great. Just a minor concern.

modifyNamespace : superuser | global(A) | NS(A)

In the code for preModifyNamespace, we have 


@Override

  public void preModifyNamespace(ObserverContext<MasterCoprocessorEnvironment> ctx,

      NamespaceDescriptor ns) throws IOException {

    requireGlobalPermission("modifyNamespace", Action.ADMIN, ns.getName());

  }

Looks like only global admin is eligible for performing this action. Similar is the case with deleteNamespace.

Looks like only global admin is eligible for performing this action. Similar is the case with deleteNamespace.

Yes, this is confusing. I had renamed requireGlobalPermission to be requireGlobalOrNamespacePermission() but not in v5 patch. I'll attach a v6 patch for that.

Here is the v6 patch. I've renamed one of the requireGlobalPermission() methods to be requireGlobalOrNamespacePermission().

Now we have to methods: 


requireGlobalPermission() => Requires global permission ONLY

requireGlobalOrNamespacePermission() => Required global or NS permissions.

deleteNamespace,modifyNamespace,grant on NS, revoke on NS, getNamespaceDescriptor uses requireGlobalOrNamespacePermission() to implement superuser | global(A) | NS(A)

It seems that the verifyDenied() does not check for the user is reaally denied. I changed the usages to be verifyDeniedWithException().

Also, slight correction on the above matrix. grant, revoke, and getPermissions on NS works with NS(A) as well. I'll edit the comment above.
+1 (non-binding). Good job Enis Soztutar.

This message is automatically generated.

preDeleteNamespace, preModifyNamespace - requires global permission, namespace permission does not allow namespace DDL permission privilege as mentioned in HBASE-8015.

Except for the special case for 'C'. Namespace privileges is mainly used as another level of hierarchy (privileges to be inherited by tables). ie We might want user to have C on namespace so he can create tables but we don't want that user to be able to drop the namespace.

Sounds good.


It seems we should allow global A to delete/modify namespace. However, in the latest patch we have requireGlobalOrNamespacePermission.
Enis Soztutar Can you confirm the behavior again. Thx.

It seems we should allow global A to delete/modify namespace. However, in the latest patch we have requireGlobalOrNamespacePermission.

We allow Global(A) and NS(A) to do deleteNamespace, modifyNamespace, getNamespaceDescriptor, and grant,revoke on NS Perms. I think this is what we want, no?

I don't think so, I discussed with Francis before he left. I thought NS A should delete NS and etc. But seems they have concerns about privilege isolation. For example, the reason we give a user NS A is not allowing them to manage NS but allowing the to have A on all tables under the NS. So NS A is only for inheritance but delete/modify/revoke/grant still need the global one to guarantee the safety.
Then can you update the patch with that?

The behavior change was introduced in HBASE-12634 days ago. Apparently, people in HBASE-8015 was supposed to participate in the discussion.

More more thing, thanks to the inheritance behavior, the method requireNamespacePermission I added is actually checking Global or NS. A requireGlobalOrNamespacePermission is not necessary.

if (authManager.authorize(user, perm)

(namespace != null && authManager.authorize(user, namespace, perm)))

this is equal to:

if (authManager.authorize(user, namespace, permission))
I'll prepare for it. thanks.

Updated patch in v8
1. raised permission to global for: grant/revoke/createNS/modifyNS/deleteNS
2. CreateTable still requires NS 'C' or global 'C'
3. some recent patches changed behavior of getUserPermission, GetNamespaceDescriptor, ListNamespaceDescriptors. Those newly added behaviors are kept in this patch, but we might want to revisit them later.

Related jiras:
HBASE-12674 Add permission check to getNamespaceDescriptor()
HBASE-12663 unify getTableDescriptors() and listTableDescriptorsByNamespace()
preGetNamespaceDescriptor/postListNamespaceDescriptors. This is a behavior change instead of a bug fix. The original design requires no permissions. Need more discussions so that we don't surprise the users.

HBASE-12622 user_permission should require global admin to display global and ns permissions
Also behaviors change. IMO, this is fine.

HBASE-12634, HBASE-12098 changed behaviors of namespace delete/modify/grant/revoke .... But only CreateTable need to be fixed, others are desired correct behaviors.

+1. I'll commit v8 if it passed hadoopqa.

The final patch implements the following: 


createNamespace        : superuser | global(A)

deleteNamespace        : superuser | global(A)

modifyNamespace        : superuser | global(A)

getNamespaceDescriptor : superuser | global(A) | NS(A)

listNamespaces         : All access*

createTable            : superuser | global(C) | NS(C)

grant 

  NS Permission        : superuser | global(A)

revoke 

  NS Permission        : superuser | global(A)

getPerms 

  NS permissions       : superuser | global(A) | NS(A)



* Returned list will only show what you can call getNamespaceDescriptor()

+1. I'll commit v8 if it passed hadoopqa.

Thanks Enis. Do we need to add some comments to the code, so that people knows it is designed this way for a reason, not a bug.
